lexUnit.name: virtuous.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: having or showing high moral standards

sentence.text: Aragorn is a remarkably virtuous character , without even the faults of Théoden , and he foreknows his death like a saint .
If I were playing an indisputably virtuous character , then cliché dictates that I would at least be spared death , imprisonment or degradation .
` Perhaps we should allow her to go ahead with her virtuous deed .
For liberalism prides itself on its rejection of moral paternalism , that is the imposition of a particular scheme of the virtuous life upon all citizens .
Evil men may be reborn as sub-human animals , but virtuous men have at least the prospect that they may escape from the cycle of rebirths into the nirvana of final extinction .
At nineteen Shallot was virtuous , a prosperous man soon to be a merchant prince who would show both Master Benjamin and the great Wolsey that he could rise without their help .
Your father was very virtuous ; and holy men at their death have goo inspirations … will no doubt never be chosen by any rightly but one who you shall rightly love .
There is , however , no Cornish equivalent to the stone Liver Bird on Merseyside that supposedly flaps its wings whenever a virtuous woman passes underneath .

The fact was that for many years she and her father had been living with a dangerous illusion ; and the illusion was that they were entirely virtuous in their endeavours , entirely on the angels ' side .
Fund raising activities should be fun -- people should not only feel virtuous at parting with their money but should gain pleasure and enjoyment too .
Roland 's stand at Roncevalles against the Moslem army and El Cid 's long campaign against the Moorish occupation of Spain vaunted the virtuous defence of Christendom .
The virtuous Scottish doctor would certainly have been shocked by our modern profligacy .
It can therefore be argued that the virtuous conduct of which mankind is capable can be regarded as varying from individual to individual by quantity only .
My concern is to show that , on , the contrary , culture and social rules may well constrain males to fit a given society 's ideas about virtuous male behaviour .
Once a virtuous king , whose subjects hailed him as a god , he was killed by his jealous brother Seth .
Such invitations and sharings of food were virtuous , and could be interesting , giving rise to good conversation .
His gregarious mother sometimes teases her son by accusing him of being too virtuous .
But I do n't want to be virtuous .
The battle in the Gulf is not about George Bush and Saddam Hussein and which of them is less virtuous than the other .
Yet it is not he but the virtuous Harry Percy who dies and poor old Falstaff who has to shoulder the opprobrium .
` I do n't want to , " said Tim , rather huffily ; Sam 's virtuous and superior tone was beginning to irritate him .
If your sister is as virtuous as you say , then she has nothing to fear from my nephew . "
